column1: Table 2. Percent distribution of employment and payrolls for the justice system, by level of government, March 2012
Series title: Justice Expenditure and Employment Extracts, 2012 - Final (Update) NCJ 250326
Data source: Justice Expenditure and Employment Extracts Program (JEEE)
Author: Emily D. Buehler, Ph.D., BJS Statistician
Table 2. Percent distribution of employment and payrolls for the justice system, by level of government, March 2012
Total justice system - Full-time equivalent employment
Judicial and legal - Full-time equivalent employment

Note: March payroll data may not sum to total because of rounding. The federal budget source provides only total employment for the federal government. That figure is included in the denominator used to compute the percent distribution of full-time employees and full-time equivalent employment for state and local governments.
